result.execSummary:
The defendant Vance E. Lindenman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent/Deliver Non-Narcotics [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense, Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
47 days sentence credit if revoked from probation.
Concurrent with: 16CF239 and 16CF240

miscConds.notes: PAYABLE DIRECTLY TO AND COLLECTED BY EAU CLAIRE COUNTY CLERK OF COURT.  NOT A CONDITION OF PROBATION.

No use or possession of illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No consumption or possession of alcohol.
No entry into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, or any other place that primarily serves/sells alcohol.
No contact with Shenanigan's Bar.
No contact with any known drug dealers or users.
May only possess/take prescription medications if and only as prescribed to him.

Pay cost of supervision.
Follow all rules of supervision.
Undergo and successfully complete any and all programming per agent.
Reimburse Eau Claire County in full for attorney fees.
Undergo AODA assessment and follow-through with recommendations.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

superMiscConds.notes: No contact with any known drug dealers/users (except in a therapeutic setting or at DOC meetings/functions).

Any conditions, programming or treatment per agent.
Maintain absolute sobriety.

Dated 04/27/2020 from defendant to Court regarding request for Sentence Adjustment with attached supporting documentation. Pursuant to the Supreme Courts Order issued 4/13/2020, this document is deemed filed 04/30/2020 because that is the date it was mailed.
Sentencing Hearing on Revocation, April 20, 2018

Cases called at 10:30 am: 15CF1286, 16CF239 and 16CF240.  Defendant Vance E. Lindenman in custody with Attorney Richard Louis Yonko.  Peter Rindal appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Counsel makes sentencing recommendations. Defendant makes statement to the Court.  15CF1286: Defendant is sentenced to 3 Years of Initial Confinement followed by 3 Years of Extended Supervision with various conditions. 16CF239: Defendant is sentenced to 1 Year and 6 Months of Initial Confinement followed by 2 Years of Extended Supervision.  16CF240: Count 1: Defendant is sentenced to 3 Years Initial Confinement followed by 3 Years of Extended Supervision with various conditions, Count 2: Defendant is sentenced to 1 Year and 6 Months of Initial Confinement followed by 3 Years of Extended Supervision with various conditions.
